verses.verse: Wine <S%H3196><s%> is a mocker <S%H3887><s%>, strong drink <S%H7941><s%> is raging <S%H1993><s%>: and whoever is deceived <S%H7686><s%> thereby is not wise <S%H2449><s%>.

The fear <S%H367><s%> of a king <S%H4428><s%> is as the roaring <S%H5099><s%> of a lion <S%H3715><s%>: whoever provokes him to anger <S%H5674><s%> sins <S%H2398><s%> against his own soul <S%H5315><s%>.
It is a honor <S%H3519><s%> for a man <S%H376><s%> to cease <S%H7674><s%> from strife <S%H7379><s%>: but every fool <S%H191><s%> will be quarreling <S%H1566><s%>.
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> will not plow <S%H2790><s%> by reason of the cold <S%H2779><s%>; therefore shall he beg <S%H7592><s%> in harvest <S%H7105><s%>, and have nothing.

Counsel <S%H6098><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> is like deep <S%H6013><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>; but a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H8394><s%> will draw it out <S%H1802><s%>.
Most <S%H7230><s%> men <S%H120><s%> will proclaim <S%H7121><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> his own goodness <S%H2617><s%>: but a faithful <S%H529><s%> man <S%H376><s%> who can find <S%H4672><s%>?
The just <S%H6662><s%> man walks <S%H1980><s%> in his integrity <S%H8537><s%>: his sons <S%H1121><s%> are blessed <S%H835><s%> after him <S%H310><s%>.
A king <S%H4428><s%> that sits in <S%H3427><s%> the throne <S%H3678><s%> of judgment <S%H1779><s%> scatters away <S%H2219><s%> all evil <S%H7451><s%> with his eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
Who can say <S%H559><s%>, I have made my heart <S%H3820><s%> clean <S%H2135><s%>, I am pure <S%H2891><s%> from my sin <S%H2403><s%>?
Various weights <S%H68><s%>, and various measures <S%H374><s%>, both <S%H8147><s%> of them are alike <S%H1571><s%> abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
Even a child <S%H5288><s%> is known <S%H5234><s%> by his doings <S%H4611><s%>, whether his work <S%H6467><s%> be pure <S%H2134><s%>, and whether it be right <S%H3477><s%>.
The hearing <S%H8085><s%> ear <S%H241><s%>, and the seeing <S%H7200><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%>, the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> even both of them <S%H8147><s%>.
Love <S%H157><s%> not sleep <S%H8142><s%>, lest you come to poverty <S%H3423><s%>; open <S%H6491><s%> your eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and you shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with bread <S%H3899><s%>.
It is naught <S%H7451><s%>, it is naught <S%H7451><s%>, says <S%H559><s%> the buyer <S%H7069><s%>: but when he is gone <S%H235><s%> his way <S%H1984><s%>, then he boasts.

There is <S%H3426><s%> gold <S%H2091><s%>, and a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of rubies <S%H6443><s%>: but the lips <S%H8193><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%> are a precious <S%H3366><s%> jewel <S%H3627><s%>.
Take <S%H3947><s%> his garment <S%H899><s%> that is sure <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger <S%H2114><s%>: and take a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of him for a strange woman <S%H5237><s%>.
Bread <S%H3899><s%> of deceit <S%H8267><s%> is sweet <S%H6156><s%> to a man <S%H376><s%>; but afterwards <S%H310><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> shall be filled <S%H4390><s%> with gravel <S%H2687><s%>.
Every purpose <S%H4284><s%> is established <S%H3559><s%> by counsel <S%H6098><s%>: and with good advice <S%H8458><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> war <S%H4421><s%>.

He that goes about <S%H1980><s%> as a gossip <S%H7400><s%> reveals <S%H1540><s%> secrets <S%H5475><s%>: therefore meddle <S%H6148><s%> not with him that flatters <S%H6601><s%> with his lips <S%H8193><s%>.
Whoever curses <S%H7043><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother <S%H517><s%>, his lamp <S%H5216><s%> shall be put out <S%H1846><s%> in obscure <S%H380><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%>.
A inheritance <S%H5159><s%> may be gotten hastily <S%H926><s%> at the beginning <S%H7223><s%>; but the end <S%H319><s%> there shall not be blessed <S%H1288><s%>.
Say <S%H559><s%> not you <S%H7999><s%>, I will recompense evil <S%H7451><s%>; but wait on <S%H6960><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and he shall save you <S%H3467><s%>.
Differing weights <S%H68><s%> are a abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; and a false <S%H4820><s%> balance <S%H3976><s%> is not good <S%H2896><s%>.
Man <S%H1397><s%>'s goings <S%H4703><s%> are of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; how can a man <S%H120><s%> then understand <S%H995><s%> his own way <S%H1870><s%>?
It is a snare <S%H4170><s%> to the man <S%H120><s%> who devours <S%H3216><s%> that which is holy <S%H6944><s%>, and after <S%H310><s%> vows <S%H5088><s%> to make enquiry <S%H1239><s%>.
A wise <S%H2450><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> scatters <S%H2219><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, and brings <S%H7725><s%> the wheel over them <S%H212><s%>.
The spirit <S%H5397><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is the candle <S%H5216><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, searching <S%H2664><s%> all the inward parts <S%H2315><s%> of the belly <S%H990><s%>.
Mercy <S%H2617><s%> and truth <S%H571><s%> preserve <S%H5341><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>: and his throne <S%H3678><s%> is upheld <S%H5582><s%> by mercy <S%H2617><s%>.
The glory <S%H8597><s%> of young men <S%H970><s%> is their strength <S%H3581><s%>: and the beauty <S%H1926><s%> of old men <S%H2205><s%> is the gray head <S%H7872><s%>.
The blueness <S%H2250><s%> of a wound <S%H6482><s%> cleanses <S%H8562><s%> away evil <S%H7451><s%>: so do stripes <S%H4347><s%> the inward parts <S%H2315><s%> of the belly <S%H990><s%>.
